line.en: 'Hey, it's starting to look like something.'
'Yeah, really!'
'If we keep this up we'll be flying before we\nknow it.'
'...No thanks, I'm good.'
'Why? It feels great!'
'I doubt it...it's probably just scary.'
'I'd rather we didn't finish this thing.'
'Heh heh... That's not gonna happen.'
'Because we have Igarashi!'
'Isn't he great? He does all that hard stuff so\neasily.'
'And he's such a gentleman... and he's so\nhandsome.'
'Hey, what's this? Are you getting jealous\nagain?'
'...No. I'm not like him because I'm so clumsy...\nand useless...'
'That's not true! Without you, we wouldn't even\nhave gotten permission to make the Soaring Club!'
'...It's not like I did anything to make that\nhappen.'
'And besides, you drew the diagrams. And they are\nfor a much better glider than this one.'
'Well, that's what I was trying to do.'
'The craft is coming along well, but I haven't\ngotten the details down yet.'

'I might have just been copying famous
foreign-made gliders. There is evidence of where
I imitated certain functions without
understanding them...'
'Okay, stop! That conversation is over.'
'Why?'
'Because it gets me all mixed up. Look, I trust\nyou with all that.'
'In spite of your fear of flying, you're drawing\ndiagrams and helping.'
'...That's because you promised me.'
'You promised to take me above the clouds.'
'He he he... You've got dreams like other girls\ntoo, huh.'
'This will definitely work out. With you and\nIgarashi too, there's nothing we can't do.'
'...Okay.'
Thanks to Tatsuya joining the Soaring Club, the\nrestoration of the glider went smoothly.
Just like Isuka said, he was an amazing person.
Because he had to help out around his house, he\ncouldn't come every day. But he still did more\nthan Isuka and I combined.
'By the way, I meant to mention it before,\nbut...'
'What?'
'Those glasses don't suit you.'
'...Really?'
'You're a beautiful girl. You should wear\ncontacts instead.'
'O... oh. Yeah?'
'Yeah, it could make you really popular with the\nboys.'
'...I don't really care if I'm not popular.'
'You never change, huh Amane?'
Time was passing in slow motion.
When I was with Isuka it was like the whole world\nwas glittering.
I remember that it was almost like that time\nwould last for all eternity.
I didn't notice at all just how important that\nglittering time was.
I would imagine the restoration going smoothly\nand the test flight waiting for me.
I was living my days like a kid waiting in line\nto get a flu shot.
'Ms. Mochizuki, I took the package upstairs.'
Since early this morning, there have been men at\nthe Flying Fish Manor bringing packages in.
'Where should I take this?'
'My room. Second floor, furthest room back.'
'Gotcha.'
'Wha... what is going on?'
'Quack?'
Hearing the noise, Kotori and Hat stuck their\nheads out from their room.
'I heard they're tools for Amane's work.'
The other day I discovered that she was living in\nthe school garage and before I knew it, I had\nforced her to come stay in Flying Fish Manor.
And after that, she officially moved in.
She's not a Keifuu Academy student, but she is a\nlecturer and it's good for her commute.
Anyway, since there's a room open we got\npermission froom the owner.
In good spirits, she called the lab and got the\ntools she needs for work sent here, but...
'Wow, this is heavy.'
'Quack, quack.'
'...Yeah, really.'
Several computers, a drafting printer, and what\nmust be a 3D scanner.
More and more equipment and tools with unknown\npurposes and applications are being carried in.
The room is turned into a research lab.
'Please come back to the lab, Mochizuki-sensei.'
'Eh... no thanks.'
'Whaaat... that's no good, Sensei.'
The older man begged Amane desperately.
'But if I'm there you all will try to give me\nmore and more work.'
'Th, that's...'
'Besides, being here I can relax and make more\nprogress on my work.'
'Tell my father that I won't be back for a little\nwhile.'
'*Groan*'
Seeing a grown man of reasonable age being swayed\nby Amane makes me realize what an amazing person\nshe is.
'...Say. Researchers really wear those white\ncoats, huh.'
'Oh yeah...'
While she moves in we prepare breakfast like we\nalways do.
'Guess we're going to need extra big portions\ntoday.'
Amane will eat about that much.
'So, she was living in the garage again. She's\nnot making any progress, is she?'
Kotori is grinning while she says such mean\nthings.
She seems overjoyed now that she can live with\nAmane again.
'An airhead like her and a guy like you with his\nhead on his shoulders make a good couple.'
'Hat thinks so too. Don't you?'
'Quack!'
'He says he does.'
'It's so reassuring that you can get a duck to\nagree with you.'
'Ahhh, I've been all over the place this morning.\nI'm so hungry!'
Amane came tottering into the dining hall.
'Breakfast will be ready soon. How is moving in\ncoming along?'
'I'm done already.'
She sits down, clearly exhausted.
'Kotori, could you bring everyone some cold tea?'
'Sure. Come on, Hat.'
'Quack.'
Kotori puts the tray of barley tea on her knees\nand heads with Hat to the front door.
I put a glass of barley tea in front of Amane.
'Here you go.'
'Amane?'
Hug.
Suddenly she stood up and hugged me.
She hugged me so that my head was pressed into\nher chest.
'Hey... Amane!'
'He he he... I've been so happy ever since this\nmorning.'
She mutters with a happiness that comes from the\nheart.
I can't tear myself away from her, hearing that.
'Kotori's going to be back soon...'
'Mmm... Oh. Right.'
I'm trying to be patient too.
'When you say that, it makes me so happy that I\nwant to let go even less.'
Yeah, but for now please be patient and let go. I\ndon't enjoy being ridiculed.
'From now on we'll be together forever.'
'Quack.'
Oh no!
'They said they finished bringing in the packages\nso they were going home...'
She says, coming in after Hat.
Evidently, we finished without being seen.
'Th, th, thank you.'
'(I'm so glad Hat came back first...)'
'Amane! Amane! We're together again from today\non!'
'Yep, together again.'
Replying happily, Amane patted the likewise happy\nKotori on the head.
'(Like I thought, Amane is defenseless against\nher.)'
If she's not careful, it will reflect.
'Ageha, is this fine here?'
'Yeah. That's good, that's good.'
'Ageha, how about this one?'
'Yeah, that's my sister! Nicely done.'
Masatsugu and Hotaru came to help and the\nrestoration of the craft was going very smoothly.
Of course Hotaru was going to come help, but I\nnever expected Masatsugu to come by.
'Damnit, I've been had.'
'Huh?'
'I only came here to see your girlfriend that I\nheard about. Now I've got to help with this\nstuff.'
'...It's that person, right? Your girlfriend, I\nmean.'
Hotaru points to the other side of the garage.
'Hmmm... with some lubricant on these joints\nhere...'
She's working now.
Unaware of the rumors being said about her, Amane\nwas staring at the computer screen and muttering\nsomething to herself.
'Yeah.'
Hotaru and Masatsugu both know Amane.
But it appears they had no idea that she is my\ngirlfriend.
I guess it is a little unexpected.
'She's pretty. Really beautiful.'
'Damn, lucky! On top of being beautiful, she's an\nolder woman!'
I've heard that Masatsugu broke up with the\ngirlfriend he used to brag about.
He said it was because their tastes in music\ndidn't match, but I don't get it.
'Hey! Quit yer yappin' and focus on your work!'
'Hmph. Never even said I wanted to help.'
While muttering complaints, Masatsugu keeps\nmoving.
All in all, he's a good and friendly guy.
We had plenty of help, so I could focus on the\nsimulator.
'(Flight seems to be more difficult to control\nthan before the improvements...)'
The tendencies it had are accentuated.
Since the aircraft was designed for the expressed\npurpose of flying the above Morning Glory, of\ncourse that goes without saying.
'(Everyone is making the glider that Amane is\ndesigning...)'
I will pilot it.
They're going to let me do the best part. I can't\nafford to fail.
We can't let it come within grasp and then slip\naway before our eyes like it did last year.
Thinking about that again brings back bitter\nmemories and breaks my concentration.
'Not enough training...'

Looking ahead blurrily, I saw Amane, who I
expected to be working, but instead she was
holding and gazing at the picture frame that was
on the desk.
I walked up from behind and peeked at the photo\nwith her.
'Those are some amazing clouds, huh. I can\nunderstand why Isuka longed for them.'
'Yeah...'
Her reply sounded ambiguous.
Looking at this picture I had a strange thought.
'What's up?'
'Uh, nothing.'
'It's just that last year we saw that cloud, and\nI was thinking 'could it have been the Morning\nGlory?''
'Huh?'
'It's like, if you look at it this way... doesn't\nit look totally different?'
Housed in the small photograph was the\nmagnificent figure of the clouds.
Outside the frame of this photo must have been an\neven more amazing sight.
Compared to this one, the clouds we saw last year\nwere beautiful, but...
'Maybe I'm thinking too hard about this.'
Whether it's a mere difference in size or perhaps\nthis picture was just taken very well...
Whatever the case, clouds like these are not a\ndime a dozen.
'Sorry about that. I didn't really mean anything\nby it.'
I apologized and went back to the simulator.
For some time, Amane looked at the photograph.
And just like that our summer vacation passed\nbefore our eyes...
When I noticed, the Obon festival was already\ncoming up.
On that day...
'Hey, Amane! Look!'
'Hm?'
'Ta-dah!'
The wings which were assembled and finished, but\nunpainted were there.
'Ohhhhh-'
'We just have to put them on, sand them and paint\nthem and they're done!'
'Yeah, but that's no easy task...'
'We've already done this much, huh...'
Amane looks over every nook and cranny of the\nnewly assembled wings.
'...Yeah, these are well done. The process\ntechnology is perfect.'
'That's because An-chan taught us.'
'Say, how do you feel? You know, seeing what you\ndesigned taking shape and all.'
'Yeah... hmm...'
She looks troubled.
'Hasn't she already had this experience a number\nof times?'
'Oh, right. That is your job, huh.'
'Uhh... oh right. Oops.'
Kotori seems bored.
We all wanted her to be as happy as we were.
That's how I felt too.
'...Yeah. But it's a strange feeling.'
'When I see it taking shape like this, little by\nlittle, it lifts my spirits...'
But faintly, her eyes were glimmering.
When we all saw that, Kotori's and then the rest\nof our eyes started glimmering too..
'I can't wait to see it fly in the sky!'
'And I've gotta come along!'
Hearing that, Ageha goes over to the wall of our\nworkplace.
'Ahem. Everyone, may I have your attention?'
She got everyone's attention.
On the wall, there was a chart of the processes.
The places where corrections had been made in red\npen catches everyone's attention.
'Thanks to Ma-bou and Hotaru here, it seems we'll\nbe able to cut down on the manufacturing time.'
Oh!
Upon hearing our jeering Ageha adds a new\ncorrection to the chart.
'How much did we shorten the manufacturing time\nby?'
'Roughly four days!'
'Oh, awesome!'

Of course, for those four days we had Masatsugu
and Hotaru's help, but Ageha and Kotori worked
really hard. And Asa and Yoru getting into the
groove of their work really helped too.
Everyone felt like this, focusing every day on\nmaking this glider was 'a precious school summer\nvacation.
'...And that means?'
'Yeah! We can do the test flight four days early\ntoo!'
'What, really? That means right after Obon!'
Ageha nods strongly.
'Of course that is assuming we don't have any\nproblems first.'
'I think we ought to keep on going like we have\nbeen.'
'Yeah, right. We have time, so rather than\nmessing it all up, we could use our lead to be\ncareful.'
'But Ma-kun, you said you want to hurry up and\nfinish so you can play.'
'Oh, yeah well I've helped this much, so I don't\nwant to leave things unfinished.'
'So that means we'll have the test flight on the\nfifteenth of this month!'
From everyone there was a raucous chorus of joy.
'So I can finally fly...'
My voice bled excitement as I whispered to\nmyself.
One year since we were chased from this garage...
And we can finally fly the skies over Kazegaura.
While everyone else was happy, Amane alone\nappeared lost in thought.
'What's wrong, Amane?'
'Yeah...actually, I also have something to say to\neveryone.'
Everyone quieted down and looked to Amane.
'The other day, Aoi talked about the Morning\nGlory, right?'
'Hm?'
What did I say?
'You did, right? Last year, that cloud we flew.\nThat it was the morning glory.'
'Yeah.'
It'd just come to me, so I had already forgotten\nabout it.
'So I got a little curious and looked into it.'
Amane went to her seat and turned the computer\nmonitor so that everyone could see.
There displayed on the screen side-by-side, were\nthe photos and video scans the alumnae took and\nthose of last year's flight too.
'Ah, this cloud.'
'The clouds we saw last summer from Windmill\nHill.'
Asa and Yoru went to Windmill Hill that day and\nsaw those clouds.
It's such an impressive scene, they must remember\nit very easily.
'So is there something wrong with this photo?'
'The two clouds in these photos are very similar.\nThat's why I never thought twice that they may be\na different phenomenon...'
'But, Aoi pointed out that they might be\ndifferent. That got me thinking and I checked it\nout...'
Not understanding what Amane was talking about,\neveryone listened silently.
'Strictly speaking, that cloud cannot really be\ncalled a Morning Glory.'
'Huh?!'
'What??'
'The mechanism that it originates from is\nsimilar, but the scale is completely different.'

'That cloud tried to become a Morning Glory, but
along the way something was lacking and it
disappeared. It was the runt of the litter, so to
speak.'
'A runt...'
I looked closely at the photos lined up on the\nscreen.
Surely, the scale was different, or rather it was\nthat the cloud we saw last year appeared to be in\nthe process of becoming a morning glory.
'So what, that's what you were saying? That since\nit happened last year it's not going to happen\nagain any time soon?'
That is what Amane said to us when she refused to\nbe our supervisor.
'That wasn't right. It is possible for it to\noccur close together...'
'What that cloud was, was a sign of the coming\nMorning Glory.'
Amane's words were enveloped by the noisy chatter\nthat erupted in the garage.
'...Of course. It takes root and develops from\nthere.'
Amane nods.
'I think you are all aware that I am contributing\nto a new windmill project.'
'As a resource for that work, I have gained\naccess to the past weather data for Kazegaura.'
Amane put that data on the LCD screen before her.
'Looking into that I learned something\ninteresting.'
'Something interesting?'
'Twenty-eight years ago... the alumnae flew the\nMorning Glory that appeared and on August 26th of\nthe previous year...'
'It is very likely that a cloud phenomenon\noccurred that was the same as the one Aoi and I\nflew in Kazegaura.'
'What does that mean?'
'In other words, it means the summer before the\nreal Morning Glory appeared, there was a runt\ncloud.'
Amane explains it simply for those of us that\ncan't follow along and Yoru looks over the past\nweather data displayed on the screen.
The rest of us can't understand even if we look\nat the data, but this girl might be able to.
'The year following the occurence of a runt\ncloud, a real Morning Glory emerges.'
'...So that means it doesn't just happen by\nchance?'
Amane shakes her head.
'Considering that it is a rare phenomenon, the\nchances that it will continue two years in a row\nare quite low.'
'That's why I tried to put this hypothesis\ntogether. I'd been wondering whether that could\nbe a sign of a coming Morning Glory.'
Our breath is taken away by her words, clearly\nstated like that.
More so than a hypothesis, we heard those words\nas a vague prophecy.
'We looked at the data, but we didn't\nunderstand...'
But that prophecy-like hypothesis had taken root\nin us just enough for us to believe.
'I believe.'
Right. None other than the prestigious Amane\nMochizuki is saying it.
'...It only means that there is a possibility. I\ncan't say anything definite about it.'
'Anyway, the mechanism behind the Morning Glory\noccurances in Kazegaura has not been\ninvestigated.'
'No doubt the lee waves coming over Mt. Tsukubae\nhave an effect...'
'That's enough for me!'
'Yeah! All we need is to hear it from you like\nthat and we'll do our very best!'
'This is great news.'
'Yeah, I'm holding my ground!'
'Ohhh!'
'It's really simple, huh.'
'Guess we might as well stick around to the end\nnow.'
'Yeah, you're right. Besides, I want to see them\nfly.'
The test flight. And the Morning Glory that might\nappear this year.
Our spirits and determination are inexorably\nrising.
'Phew... that was a nice, hot bath.'
'Hey, Amane.'
'Heya Kotori.'
'Do you have a second?'
'Hm?'
'What's up?'
'I thought I'd return this...'
'...Is that Isuka's flight log?'
'Yeah, it is weird that I had it, huh.'
'It's not like that, but...'
'No, I think you should have it. I mean, the best\nfriend she mentions in there must be you.'
'...Me, huh? Actually, long ago... no, not so\nlong ago, just a year ago...'
'I hated school. I had no friends and there was\nnothing fun about it...'
'I tried to quit school and go home.'
'Oh?'
'Do you not have lots of friends? It always seems\nlike you're having fun at school.'
'That's after I met you. And Aoi became our dorm\nmother and I became friends with Ageha...'
'Asa and Yoru joined the club and I made a lot of\nother friends...'
'Now there are so many things I want to do. Every\nday really is fun.'
'But before that... remembering makes me shiver,\nit was so bleak. I was serious about quitting the\nschool.'
'But that would be like throwing my life away\nlike one does a white dove. Aoi made me hold on\nto that.'
'...Before I'd met you or Aoi, I had no friends\nand really hated myself.'
'For me, that diary was like my salvation.'
'...This diary?'
'*coughs*'
'Isuka--I suppose she didn't have many friends?'
'You've got it. Tatsuya and I were about the only\nones she could call her friends.'
'...I thought so.'

'The atmosphere seems similar somehow. Even
though I want friends, I can't say it and it's
almost like I'm just being timid in the
corner...'
'I felt for her, I mean.'
'That's why every day after school I would come\nhome and while I read that diary in this room...'
'...I'd think like Isuka was my friend too.'
'Dreaming of flying the skies with Isuka... I\nfelt like contributing to making a glider\nmyself.'
'Doing so distracted me from my lonlieness.'
'...Now that you mention it, you said that\nreading this diary got you interested in\ngliders.'
'Huh... I didn't realize you'd been dreaming with\nIsuka this whole time.'
'I also imagined the 'best friend' that appeared\nin this diary. I wondered what kind of girl she\nwas.'
'It said that she was incredibly smart and\nbeautiful, though a little strange.'
'Yeah, I read it too.'
'I thought, if I could make friends with this\ngirl...'
'Hee hee. But you have.'
'...Yeah. But it's a strange feeling.'
'You were really guided by Isuka when you came to\nthat garage...'
'Yup. That's why I really owe her.'
'If she could heard you, she'd be really happy.'
'Ehehe... Yeah, maybe...'
'Come to think of it, maybe you should have...'
'No, I'm just pretending. You're the one who was\nthe most important to Isuka.'
'If you're going to continue on her dream, I want\nyou to have it... as her friend.'
'...As her friend.'
'Pretty soon you're going to finish the wings you\ndesigned for her.'
'Hee hee... I'm looking forward to the test\nflight.'
'Yeah, me too.'
'Oh, and hey... please don't tell anyone about\nwhat I said. Even Aoi. They'd definitely laugh.'
'Oh, I don't think so.'
'Even if they wouldn't, you can't tell them! I'd\nbe so embarrassed!'
'I understand. It'll be our secret.'
'Yeah.'
'...Amane?'
'Hm? Hey Aoi.'
I thought there might be some signs of life from\nthe dining hall and I peeked in. Amane had her\nnotebook open on the table.
'What's going on that's got you here so late?'
Asked like that, she checked the clock on the\nwall.
It was already around midnight.
'...Oh, it is late.'
It seems she got too focused and forgot about the\ntime.
The notebook she had open was Isuka's flight log.
'Kotori said I should hold on to this...'
'I think so too.'
'...Yeah.'
I got a drink from the fridge, poured two glasses\nand put one in front of her.
'Thanks.'
'You look really happy while you read that.'
She laughs and looks impressed, looks perplexed,\nsad and twists her face as if to wretch.
'Maybe it's because the time you spent with Isuka\nwas so happy.'
That was a little painful for me.
The most precious time for Amane was not the time\nwith me, but the time she spent with her friend\nIsuka.
But this wasn't something I wanted; it was just\njealousy.
And I still have our future ahead of me.
'Isuka brought color to my life.'
'Color?'
She nods.
'Before I met her, my world was monotone...'
'...What do you mean?'
The world was monotone...
'I mean what I said. That's how the world looked\nto me.'
She must mean that the world looked like a black\nand white video.
'It's not like I can't recognize colors. Apples\nlook red and the clear sky looks blue.'
'But that's how I felt... that color...'
'I think I probably wasn't having fun.'
'You weren't?'
She nods gently.
'I used to think that there was only one right\nanswer in this world.'
'To any question, that there was really only one\nanswer. I believed it as a matter of course,\nwithout any doubt.'
'Isuka said to me...'
'...'You're dumb.''
'Huh, 'dumb,' she said?'
'Yup. Dumb.'
Amane told me of these memories happily somehow,\nand with pride.
'That was the first time anyone ever called me\ndumb.'
'Before that no one had ever called me anything\nother than 'smart' or 'brilliant.''
Since a young age, Amane was probably hailed as a\nchild prodigy by all those around her.
No doubt, there was no one who called that child\n'dumb'.
However, Isuka was wrong.
She probably just said it like it was nothing.
'Of course, I didn't understand why I was called\ndumb.'
'And then Isuka went on like this...'
'...I don't think there is right or wrong.'

'...You are the only one who can decide what is
right for you. Don't you think so? Because there
are a lot of things that are wrong for other
people.'
'...So I don't want people to decide what is\nright for me.'
'--f you are confused, you should listen to\nyourself.'
'That's...'
'Hee hee... You said the same thing to me too,\nhuh.'
When she refused to be our supervisor I said\nsomething similar to her.
But I was desperate then. It's not like I was\nthinking that deeply.
'When I heard her say that, honestly, I was\nreally shocked.'
'I mean, there's only one answer to a test\nquestion. I thought those were the rules of the\nworld.'
'But Isuka laughs at me and says that there are\nas many answers as there are people.'
'That's when I thought that... She was the real\ngenius.'
Come to think of it, Amane did say every time\nthat Isuka is a genius.
'She taught me that I'm dumb.'
'That was a close call. If she hadn't been\nwatching out for me I might still be parading\naround thinking 'Oh, I'm such a genius!''
Again she talks joyfully.
She often said things like 'That's because I'm\ndumb' and whatnot, but at that time she was\nalways proud.
'Isuka taught me a lot of other things too.'
'The smell of the wind, the comfort of sunshine,\nthe melancholy of a rainy day, the taste of hot\ntea on a cold winter day...'
'Skipping class and mischief-making and leaving\nthe school to go to the convenience store...'
'...You're like, headed down a slippery slope\nthere.'
'Before the school changed, there was a way\noutside from the back of the garage.'
'We used to go out all the time and buy ice cream\nduring the summer and warm pork buns in the\nwinter.'
She looks like any second now she's going to be\nslobbering and drooling over that food.
Maybe at that time she really loved to eat.

The story is of some very precious memories, but
looking at it from the outside it's like a bad
student taught a bunch of naughty stuff to a good
one.
'The right things and the wrong things... Good\nthings and bad things... The useful and the\nuseless...'
'I didn't think about things that way and Isuka\ntaught me that there was more to it.'
'No... that there is more to most things in the\nworld.'
'After I started thinking that way, the world\nbegan to shine. I started to see little sparkles\neverywhere.'
'She gave my world color.'
She tells me about these precious memories with\nher eyes shining.
Looking at the profile of her face,
'(Ah, I love her...)'
I thought.
Like a boy my clear eyes are full of curiosity,\nlooking up toward the sky, retaining innumerable\ncountless lights.
I came to like and long for Amane's profile.
'It could be that she really is an unmistakable\ngenius.'
However, there is no doubt that because of that\neverything was in a sort of planned harmony.
Regardless of whether or not she can do things,\nshe understands the results.
She doesn't enjoy anything and she has no\ninterests.
That may be why she felt like her world was\nmonotone.
Meeting Isuka was the key to Amane becoming who\nshe is today.
'Isuka is a good friend and benefactor.'
'Yeah.'
She nods deeply.
However, those eyes were soon cloudy with\nsadness.
'But she's gone now.'
'So abruptly, without saying anything.'
'After that day, my world went back to monotone.'
As she turned her face, those excited eyes that\nwere so full of hope became the profile of a face\nsunken in sadness.
Seeing that reminded me of something An-chan told\nme once.
... After Isuka was gone, Amane changed. She\ndidn't approach people anymore.
He says that's how they drifted apart.
I can't imagine her that way now, but...
'(When I asked her to be our club supervisor, I\ndid sort of get that feeling.)'
It was like she was purposefully trying to\ndistance herself from us.
'...But even still, you continued to make the\nglider on your own.'
In silence, Amane continued to flip through the\ndiary until she stopped on the last page.
Her eyes fell...
...on the words written there:
...I want to pass through the passage of clouds.
'Isuka promised me. She said the would take me\nabove those clouds.'
'She said that even I, who didn't care to go at\nall, would be moved by it.'
'I kept up the construction as if she could come\nback at any time.'
'But deep down, I understood. That she wasn't\ncoming back.'
'Then, why...'
Why did she continue to stay in that garage?
'I thought that... as long as I kept my promise\nto her, my time with her was frozen in place.'
'But the last time comes for all things.'
'...When we flew last year. That day, huh.'
Amane nods.
As she watched the clouds disappear, she\nmuttered,
...This is goodbye.
That was probably the resolution to her time with\nIsuka... the transition of that time into memory.
'So that's why you tried to refuse becoming our\nsupervisor.'
'Mhm. Being touched by those memories of Isuka\nagain was painful.'
As she speaks in that apologetic tone, I clasp\nher hand softly.
In order to tell her that there's no need to feel\nthat way.
'...But then why did you come back to us?'
'I remembered the fun we had.'
'Flying the glider I designed to fly. It's such\nan obvious thing, but it was a wondrous and\nexciting feeling.'
'Thanks to you and Kotori and everyone, I\nremembered those feelings.'
'And that's when I noticed. The most precious\ntime for me was not just hanging out with Isuka.'
'The most precious time hadn't yet ended.'
'I'd only thought it had ended, but really you\nguys picked up where I left off.'
'Even though it was my fault that we lost the\ngarage and glider, you were all there for me.'
I put some strength into my hand as I clasped\nAmane's hand.
We continued on... and I have thought time and\nagain whether or not that was the right thing to\ndo.
Honestly, I also thought of quitting many times.
If I wanted to fly a glider, there were other\nways. And there are plenty other fun activities\nto find if I look.
But I couldn't let go.
Just like Amane when she couldn't let go of her\npromise with Isuka.
It's too important to want to let go of it.
'Hey, you're our senior. We listen to everything\nyou say. If you teach us to be dumb, we'll be\ndumb.'
'Hee hee. Yeah, we're all dumb.'
Amane suddenly laughed and wiped a tear from the\ncorner of her eye with a finger.
'I'm really looking forward to the test flight\nnow.'
'The moment when everyone's work will take\nshape.'
'The dream you two left to us.'
'The... dream,'
she muttered, and traced the edge of the notebook\nwith her finger.
It could be that she is still hesitant to face\nher memories of Isuka.
'How do you see the world now?'
She stared blankly at me.
She stared at me and then returned the hand I\nheld hers with.
'Umm... it sparkles pink.'
The answer I got back was a little different from\nwhat I'd expected.
'If you're with me, it's always pink. And the air\ntastes sweet to breathe.'
'O...oh, yeah?'
If I prodded too deeply I might have spoiled the\nemotional conversation we'd just had.
'It's late. I'm gonna get going.'
'Yeah...'
When I stood up, Amane, still sitting, held my\nhand and looked at me with apparent\ndisappointment that I was leaving.
I took a quick look at the dining hall entrance\nand leaned over.
'Mmm.'
'Mm...Mmm... Smooch'
'That's a goodnight kiss,'
I said shyly. Amane smiled and looked satisfied.
'Alright. I'm going home.'
'Okay. Goodnight,'
She said, and slouched onto the desk.
'What are you doing?'
'Hm? What do you think? I'm going to sleep.'
'Why don't you go back to your own room?'
'There's no place to sleep in there...'
'...Why not?'
'It's too much of a hassle.'
Her room was buried under heaps of work-related\ndocuments and materials, so she'd lost any space\nto sleep.
'Wha... the dining hall table is no place to\nsleep!'
'Why not? There's a fan and it's pretty big. It's\nmore comfortable than you'd think.'
'...This girl.'
'Sleep in my bed.'
'May I?'
'Yeah. I'll sleep on the floor.'
I can't let her sleep in the dining hall, but\nit's also midnight and we can't clean up her room\neither.
'You should just sleep on the bed as well.'
'...I'm not confident I can keep my senses.'
'I don't see why you have to keep them...'
'There's good reason to!'
Because next door, Kotori is sleeping.
It's times like this we should be moderate.
'...I still think there's no reason to.'
Amane murmured sounding disappointed, crawled\ninto bed.
Three seconds later.
'Zzz...Zzz...'
'What? She's already asleep?!'
She was really good at falling asleep.
'...and I wanted another kiss goodnight.'
I kissed Amane on the cheek as she slept deeply\nand went to sleep under my blankets on the floor.
From morning on, that day was mostly sunny.
'Okaaay, okaay...stop!'
'Are we ready to go?'
An-chan got out of the pickup truck that pulled\nup to the front of the garage.
'Yeah, we're already done loading up.'
'Alright, link 'em up.'
Ageha connected the trailer to the back of the\npickup.
The glider was loaded into the trailer.
'Finally, we've got it.'
'Yup.'
We finished the improvements late last night.
Though we had some unexpected trouble that took\nsome tending to, we worked hard late into the\nnight so we could have the test flight on time.
Starting today, we face the runway.
And then we fly!
'Got it, An-chan.'
'Alright. Let's go.'
'You're here!'
'Heeeey!'
Kotori was waiting at the runway. She had gone\nahead to prepare the winch and whatnot.
An-chan stopped the truck that was pulling the\ntrailer by the side of the runway.
'Let's hurry and put it together!'
At Club Leader Kotori's command, everyone split\nup and started the glider's assembly.
We unload the piles of disassembled parts from\nthe trailer.
'Yoru, hold that.'
'Okay. Hrmph, got it...'
'Don't bump into anything. Careful...'
We finished the improvements to the craft last\nnight.
So we haven't yet seen it all put together.
'No, no. Not there. Lower it. The foundation...'
We haven't done this in a year either.
While recalling how we did this last summer, we\nteach this to the new members.
'Finally, we've got something.'
'...Yeah.'
'How do you feel?'
'Sort of strange. Until recently this glider was\nlike a figment of my imagination.'
'Just phantom wings I'd dreamt up...'
'Yeah. But they really did make them.'
'...My heart's been beating so hard this morning\nthat it's getting on my nerves. I need to calm\nmyself.'
'You're excited, eh.'
'Mhm. But nervous too.'
'Why?'
'To me, that glider is... it's like a fragment of\nIsuka's and my dream given a real shape.'
'...Ah, that's right.'
'We got it.'
'Alright, assembly's finished.'
There was the form of the white glider on the\ncarpet-like, green summer grass that had\novergrown onto the runway.
It's a streamlined body.
They protruded out in front, those giant wings.
The newborn aircraft, bathed in the summer\nsunlight, sparkled so much it was blinding.
'Whoaaaa...'
'Huhhh...'
It was the first time for the first years to see\nthe assembled glider up close.
The aircraft, warped by the enormity of the\nwings, made their eyes sparkle as they stared.
'So this is it...'
'It's a beautiful craft...'
The third years were affected the same.
They looked at the aircraft they had made as it\nwere a gift that had fallen from the heavens.
'Alright. Let's get underway with preparing for\nflight.'
With those words everyone came back to their\nsenses.
We didn't come here to build it and then stare at\nit all day long.
We're going to fly.
Now, and with this glider.
'Aoi, take the cockpit.'
'Roger.'
I get into the cockpit and start to check the\nflight systems.
This is the aircraft's first flight since the\nimprovements, so I do the preflight check very\ncarefully.
While Ageha confirmed the items to be checked,\nshe explained the necessity of it to Asa and\nYoru.
'How is it, Amane?'
'I'm not seeing any problems.'
Finally, Amane having had a look over, the check\nis finished.
Then, with the flight preparations ready...
'Heeey.'
'Aooii.'
'Oh, it's Hotaru and Masatsugu.'
Masatsugu, Hotaru, and for some reason, Akari\nshowed up at the runway.
'Hey guys, welcome to the party!'
'Hey, hey. We came to watch.'
'Ah, the glider is done.'
Masatsugu and Hotaru saw the glider and yelled\nout happily.
'Good morning, everyone!'
'Mornin', student council president. What are you\nhere for?'
'Tasaki told me you were doing the test flight\ntoday. If I'm not in the way, would it be all\nright if I watched?'
Kotori grinned, hearing that.
'Of course you can watch the glider we made!'
Kotori made a face like she was eager to show\noff.
We all felt the same way, so Kotori was pretty\nmuch speaking for all of us.
'An-chan.'
'Yo, you guys came too, huh.'
'It's terrible. Ageha worked our hands to the\nbone.'
'Ahh, I heard. Heard you did great work too.'
An-chan pats Hotaru and Masatsugu on the head.
They both look happy to be praised by him.
'All right, let's fly! You good to go, Aoi?'
'Anytime.'
'What are you going to do about the back seat?'
'Oh yeah...'
'Hm? No thanks, I'm okay.'
'Don't hold back, Amane. After all you did, it's\nonly right that you should ride first.'
'No one's holding back. I was asked and I'm not\nriding,'
she said, stubbornly.
Her fear of heights hasn't changed a bit in the\nlast year.
I was really looking forward to our date in the\nsky, but I guess that's not going to happen.
'Well, how about you, Kotori?'
'Huh? Me?'
'You are the club leader, after all. Right, Aoi?'
'Yeah, that's right. And I promised last year\ntoo.'
When I got my pilot's license I promised her.
I would take her with me first once I was able to\npilot the glider on my own.
'(heart pounding) All right, okay.'
'Asa, Yoru, we're going to load Kotori from\nbehind. Give me a hand.'
'Don't talk about me like I'm a suitcase!'
From a ways off, Amane watched the buzz of the\nlaunch preparations.
It was like she was looking at a far away land.
And she seemed lonely.
I get out of the cockpit and walk over to her.
'Amane.'
'What's wrong, Aoi?'
'Umm, was that... I guess that was a little tough\non you.'
'Hm? Oh, yeah a little.'
It was still bitter for her to face her memories\nof Isuka, so she was trying to distance herself\nfrom the glider.
But she also treasures the time we've had\ntogether and that's why she came back.
She said she was looking forward to the test\nflight, but she still hasn't gotten her feelings\nfor Isuka in order.
'...This is the craft that you designed as a\npromise to Isuka, right?'
'Yeah, that's right.'
'So that means when this glider flies the memory\nIsuka will be near too.'
'That promise hasn't been fulfilled yet.'
I thought it was a little shameless.
That I would delve into her past...
Her precious yet sad memories, which I knew\nnothing about.
But I thought that she might also forgive me.
Because I am her boyfriend, after all.
'W, we are going to take this glider to the other\nside of that cloud.'
'...Thank you.'
She looked a little lonely, but laughed for me.
'I'm gonna get going.'
'Okay. Be careful.'
I left her side and returned to the cockpit.
'Kotori, you okay?'
'Y, yeah. I'm fine. But I'm so excited it's like\nmy heart is going to explode.'
'Ageha, we're good to go.'
'Roger. Asa, Yoru, let's go!'
The canopy was closed.
The moment of our return had come... to the\nKazegaura sky.
The glider Aoi and Kotori are in is connected to\nthe winch by a tow line.
In the canopy, the two of them look nervous.
But they look like they are having fun too.
Because unlike me, they're not afraid of flying.
Or rather, they want to fly.
It's almost like they might say they belong in\nthe sky.
'Flight preparations complete! Yoru, the winch!'
Ageha gestured toward the winch installed on the\nother side.
And in the next moment, the glider was launched\nfrom the tow line!
After a few seconds Aoi pulled on the control\nstick and the craft climbed upwards.
For an instant, I swallowed my breath.
But the altitude was still low.
Having lost the friction of the ground, the\nglider accelerated steadily.
The nose turned upward.
With its huge wings spread out, the white craft\nsoared up into the sky.
... If you're going to continue on her dream, I\nwant you to have it... as her friend.
Said Kotori, and then she passed me Isuka's\nflight log.
At that time, I'd thought 'then maybe it's best\nthat I don't have it.
'(How about me, I wonder...)'
'(Am I still dreaming the same dream?)'
...So that means when this glider flies the\nmemory Isuka will be near too.
As I resurrected, his words brought back thoughts\nI had kept inside.
I look at the sky.
The tow line, with its small parachute open, came\nfloating down.
Released from the winch, the glider flew through\nthe sky on the air caught by our wings.
Isuka dreamed and I drew...
And then they gave it form--our glider.
'Look, Isuka...'
'The wings you and I dreamt up...they're flying\nnow.'
Looking up, the sky is a crisp blue.
The white wings glimmered, reflecting the light\nof the sun.
I'm still dreaming...
Because from where I'm standing, it is before the\nday we exchanged promises.
